qas.question: What cults weakened Buddhism in India?
What replaced Buddha in ruling centers?
What kind of temples were built for Hindu Gods?
What was the style of worship of Hindu Gods?
By what dentury did Buddhism disappear form much of India?

context: Ronald Inden writes that by the 8th century CE symbols of <a1_0>Hindu gods<a1_0/> "replaced the Buddha at the imperial centre and pinnacle of the cosmo-political system, the image or symbol of the Hindu god comes to be housed in a <a2_0>monumental<a2_0/> temple and given increasingly <a3_0>elaborate<a3_0/> imperial-style puja worship". Although Buddhism did not disappear from India for several centuries after the <a4_0>eighth<a4_0/>, royal proclivities for the cults of <a0_0>Vishnu and Shiva<a0_0/> weakened Buddhism's position within the sociopolitical context and helped make possible its decline.
